sentence.Network_en: He swore fealty to the king.
He swore fealty to his lord.
Round many western islands have I been Which Bards in fealty to Apollo hold.
sentence.Network_cn: 还有多少西方的海岛,歌都已使它们向阿波罗臣服.

list.abs: he swore fealty to the king ., 他宣誓效忠国王.
...两个部分，忠顺誓言（act of homage）和效忠宣誓（oath of fealty）。
the nobles swore fealty to the king ., 贵族们国王宣誓效忠.
fealty ethic cultivation of college students ., 大学生孝亲伦理道德培养.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French feau(l)tè, fealte, from Latin fidelitas (see fidelity)

entry.def: In former times, if someone swore fealty to their ruler, they promised to be loyal to him or her.

means.word_mean: 1. the loyalty that citizens owe to their country (or subjects to their sovereign)
